org.jpws.front

Class GUIService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.front.GUIService

  • public class GUIService
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of minor GUI-oriented services like message boxes, etc. All methods of this class are EDT-safe, which means they guarantee GUI active routines to perform on the EDT.

      • enterNewPassphrase

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase enterNewPassphrase(PwsFileContainer ct,
                                                                    java.lang.String filename)
        Lets the user input a new passphrase for a file. This includes verification through double input and testing for password quality.
        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer if called from a file container, may be null
        filename - filename to be displayed in input request
        Returns:
        a valid passphrase or null if the action was cancelled

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile chooseSaveFile(java.awt.Component parent,
                                                              java.lang.String title,
                                                              int filetype,
                                                              int filters,
                                                              java.io.File startFile)
        Lets the user enter a filepath from the local file system for a file of various types by offering a file chooser dialog.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent display component
        title - dialog title text
        filetype - functional orientation (*_CHOOSER type constants; default = 0)
        filters - optional file filter types as of class FileOpenDialog; (defaults = -1)
        startFile - an optional selected start file in local file system
        Returns:
        ContextFile with chosen filepath or null if broken

      • overwriteConfirm

        public static boolean overwriteConfirm(java.awt.Component owner,
                                       org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile file)
        Asks the user to confirm to overwrite the specified file. If feasible the time of last modification of this file is displayed.

        file - ContextFile the context-file to be overwritten
        Returns:
        boolean user decision

      • passwordControl

        public static boolean passwordControl(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase pass,
                                      java.lang.String filename,
                                      boolean exitActive)
        Asks the user via a password input dialog to enter a password. Controls whether the input equals the password defined by the parameter. If both values mismatch, a corresponding message is displayed to indicate a failure.
        Parameters:
        pass - PwsPassphrase the password control value
        filename - String name of the file in question (only filename; may be null)
        exitActive - boolean if true the dialog shows a program exit button
        Returns:
        true if and only if the entered password equals pass

      • passwordControl

        public static boolean passwordControl(PwsFileContainer c,
                                      boolean exitActive)
        Asks the user via a password input dialog to enter a password. Controls whether the input equals the password defined by the parameter database container. If values don't match, a corresponding message is displayed to indicate a failure.
        Parameters:
        c - PwsFileContainer as a database reference
        exitActive - if true the dialog shows a program exit button
        Returns:
        true if and only if the parameter container holds a database and the entered passphrase equals the passphrase that is defined for that database

      • passwordControl

        public static boolean passwordControl(PwsFileContainer c)
        Asks the user via a password input dialog to enter a password. Controls whether the input equals the password defined by the parameter database container. If values don't match, a corresponding message is displayed to indicate a failure.
        Parameters:
        c - PwsFileContainer as a database reference
        Returns:
        true if and only if the parameter container holds a database and the entered passphrase equals the passphrase that is defined for that database

      • userConfirmOption

        public static int userConfirmOption(java.awt.Component owner,
                                    java.lang.String text)
        Asks the user (dialog) to confirm a given question with "Yes", "No" or "Cancel". The possible return values are JOptionPane.YES_OPTION, JOptionPane.NO_OPTION, JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION. In case of broken dialog thread, the cancel value is returned.
        Parameters:
        owner - the parent component for the dialog; if null the current mainframe window is used
        text - the question as text or token
        Returns:
        the user decision as an integer

      • userConfirmOption

        public static int userConfirmOption(java.lang.String text)
        Asks the user to confirm a given question with "Yes", "No" or "Cancel". The dialog is centered within the application's mainframe. The possible return values are JOptionPane.YES_OPTION, JOptionPane.NO_OPTION, JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION. In case of broken dialog thread, the cancel value is returned.
        Parameters:
        text - the question as text or token
        Returns:
        the user decision as an integer

      • userConfirmListParsing

        public static int userConfirmListParsing(java.awt.Component owner,
                                         java.lang.String title,
                                         java.lang.String text,
                                         int type)
        Asks the user to confirm a given question with "Yes", "No" or "Cancel" while there is an additional option "Yes to All". This applies best for parsing lists with choices on elements.
        Parameters:
        owner - the parent component for the dialog; if null the current mainframe window is used
        title - the dialog title or null for a default
        text - the question as text or token
        type - int, determines additional option with GUIService.YES_TO_ALL_OPTION or 0 for no additional option
        Returns:
        int user decision, JOptionPane.YES_OPTION, JOptionPane.NO_OPTION, JOptionPane.CANCEL_OPTION, GUIService.YES_TO_ALL_OPTION

      • userCombiInput

        public static boolean userCombiInput(java.awt.Component owner,
                                     java.lang.String title,
                                     java.lang.String msg,
                                     java.awt.Component[] content)
        Presents the user a message text plus a combination of other display/input components in a confirm dialog with OK and CANCEL button. Returns the user choice of termination button through a boolean value.
        Parameters:
        owner - parent component, may be null
        title - dialog title, may be null for default
        msg - presented top element (message); may be null
        content - array of components to be shown (top to down)
        Returns:
        boolean true == "OK" pressed, false == "CANCEL" pressed

      • loginInput

        public static java.lang.String loginInput(java.awt.Component owner,
                                          java.lang.String title,
                                          java.lang.String msg)
        Presents the user with an input request for a login consisting of user-name and password. The input is returned in a single string with the format "user:password". The dialog is a confirm dialog with OK and CANCEL button. This returns the input result in case of "OK" or null in case of user abortion.
        Parameters:
        owner - parent component, may be null
        title - dialog title, may be null for default
        msg - presented top element (message); may be null
        Returns:
        String formatted input result or null if user cancel

      • userOptionInput

        public static int userOptionInput(java.awt.Component owner,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String msg,
                                  java.lang.String[] choices,
                                  MessageDialog.MessageType msgType,
                                  boolean cancelOption)
        Shows a dialog with a message text and a list of button-borne choices the user can select from. The choice performed, or CANCEL, are returned as an integer value. CANCEL is always a possible return value independent of the setting of "cancelOption".
        Parameters:
        owner - parent component; may be null
        title - dialog title; may be null
        msg - presented top element (message); may be null
        choices - String[] where each element is the text of a choice available to the user; may be null
        msgType - MessageDialog.MessageType determines icon + appearance
        cancelOption - boolean whether a dialog cancel option should be available
        Returns:
        int user choice (0..nrOfChoices-1; -1 for cancel; -2 for interrupted/exception)
        Since:
        0.6.0

      • userOptionInput

        public static int userOptionInput(java.awt.Component owner,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String msg,
                                  java.lang.String[] choices,
                                  boolean cancelOption)
        Shows a dialog with a message text and a list of button-borne choices the user can select from. The choice performed, or CANCEL, are returned as an integer value. CANCEL is always a possible return value independent of the setting of "cancelOption".
        Parameters:
        owner - parent component; may be null
        title - dialog title; may be null
        msg - presented top element (message); may be null
        choices - String[] where each element is the text of a choice available to the user; may be null
        cancelOption - boolean whether a dialog cancel option should be available
        Returns:
        int user choice (0..nrOfChoices-1; -1 for cancel)
        Since:
        0.6.0

      • integerInput

        public static int integerInput(java.awt.Component parent,
                               java.lang.String title,
                               java.lang.String msg,
                               int low,
                               int high,
                               int init)
                        throws UserBreakException
        Organises user entry of an integer within a given range. The user may cancel the operation in which case an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent component for window
        title - dialog title (defaults)
        msg - dialog message (defaults)
        low - lower bound of validity range
        high - higher bound of validity range
        init - initial edit value
        Returns:
        a valid user input
        Throws:
        UserBreakException - if cancel was pressed or irregular end of dialog

      • generateRandomPassphrase

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase generateRandomPassphrase(java.awt.Component parent,
                                                                          java.lang.String title,
                                                                          org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrasePolicy policy)
        Creates a new secret passphrase from a cryptographically satisfying random generator. Shows a dialog which displays the generated passphrase and offers option to modify the parameter passphrase policy.
        Parameters:
        parent - Component parent component for dialog; may be null
        title - String title of dialog; null for default
        policy - PwsPassphrasePolicy passphrase policy for generation (may get edited and modified during the dialog)
        Returns:
        PwsPassphrase a newly generated passphrase or null if dialog was broken or cancelled
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • closeHelpDialog

        public static void closeHelpDialog(java.lang.String token)
        Closes an open help dialog (and removes if from object registry).
        Parameters:
        token - systematic name of the help dialog; should start with "dlg.help." followed by an individual name

      • isRegisteredObject

        public static boolean isRegisteredObject(java.lang.String name)
        Whether an object with the specified name is registered in the service's object map. (This e.g. holds open help dialogs.)
        Parameters:
        name - systematic name of the object
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if an object with the given name is registered

      • toggleHelpDialog

        public static void toggleHelpDialog(java.awt.Window owner,
                                    java.lang.String token)
        Starts or closes a non-modal help dialog. Can be called repeatedly but only one object is created until it is disposed (e.g. by user "Cancel"). The dialog bounds are memorised in global options and it moves connected with its parent window.

        Convention on resources: a) dialog title from Display resource bundle with code == token b) dialog content from a file in "#standards" resource directory with name defined in Commands resource bundle entry "html.file." + token

        Parameters:
        owner - Dialog or Frame as the help dialog owner; if null the global main frame is referenced
        token - systematic name of the help dialog; should start with "dlg.help." followed by an individual name
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • startHelpDialog

        public static void startHelpDialog(java.awt.Window owner,
                                   java.lang.String token)
        Starts a non-modal help dialog. Can be called repeatedly but only one object is created until it is disposed (e.g. by user "Cancel"). The dialog bounds are memorised in global options and it moves connected with its parent window.

        Convention on resources: a) dialog title from Display resource bundle with code == token b) dialog content from a file in "#standards" resource directory with name defined in Commands resource bundle entry "html.file." + token

        Parameters:
        owner - Dialog or Frame as the help dialog owner; if null the global main frame is referenced
        token - systematic name of the help dialog; should start with "dlg.help." followed by an individual name
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • failureMessage

        public static void failureMessage(java.lang.String text,
                                  java.lang.Exception e)
        Displays an error message dialog referring to the parameter exception.
        Parameters:
        text - the message token or plain text; if null a standard message is used
        e - if not null this exception is reported in the message text

      • getDesktopContainerCombo

        public static javax.swing.JComboBox getDesktopContainerCombo()
        Returns a non-editable JComboBox loaded with the currently available database containers represented by their database name.
        Returns:
        JComboBox, option loaded

      • getGroupListCombo

        public static javax.swing.JComboBox getGroupListCombo(java.util.List<java.lang.String> values,
                                                      boolean editable,
                                                      int limit)
        Returns a specialised JComboBox for the GROUP field of a PWS record with added logic. The combo reflects all available distinct GROUP values in the parameter value list.

        If the WIDTH limit is exceeded by the concrete data set, a combo with a prototype-display is rendered and Tooltips are shown for each item value displaying the complete value. The combo is displayed with DATAFONT.

        Parameters:
        values - List containing group values, may be null
        editable - boolean whether the combo is rendered editable
        limit - int intended maximum width in pixels of the combo

      • getGroupListCombo

        public static javax.swing.JComboBox getGroupListCombo(PwsFileContainer ct,
                                                      boolean editable,
                                                      int limit)
        Returns a specialised JComboBox for the GROUP field of a PWS record with added logic. The combo reflects all available distinct GROUP values in the parameter database.

        If the WIDTH limit is exceeded by the concrete data set, a combo with prototype-display of the given width is rendered and Tooltips are shown for each item value displaying the complete value. The combo is displayed with DATAFONT.

        Parameters:
        ct - PwsFileContainer container that harbours the database
        editable - boolean whether the combo is rendered editable
        limit - int intended maximum width in pixels of the combo

      • failureMessage

        public static void failureMessage(java.awt.Component owner,
                                  java.lang.String text,
                                  java.lang.Exception e)
        Displays an error message dialog referring to the parameter exception.
        Parameters:
        owner - Component owner of the message dialog
        text - the message token or plain text; if null a standard message is used
        e - if not null this exception is reported in the message text

      • getWindowForComponent

        public static java.awt.Window getWindowForComponent(java.awt.Component parentComponent)
                                             throws java.awt.HeadlessException
        Returns the specified component's toplevel Frame or Dialog. (Note: Taken from JOptionPane JDK 1.6)
        Parameters:
        parentComponent - the Component to check for a Frame or Dialog
        Returns:
        the Frame or Dialog that contains the component, or the default frame if the component is null, or does not have a valid Frame or Dialog parent
        Throws:
        java.awt.HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless returns true
        See Also:
        GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless()
